action: I want to automatically generate daily, weekly, and monthly business reports
reason: To prevent manual aggregation errors and enable rapid decision-making
acceptance_criteria: Report generation is only executable by authenticated users.
Report viewing permissions are controlled on a per-role basis.
The target period (daily/weekly/monthly) can be specified.
An error occurs if the target period is not specified.
Report data is automatically aggregated from the database.
Aggregation processing guarantees transaction consistency.
Logical deleted records are excluded from the aggregation target data.
Supported report output formats are PDF, CSV, and Excel.
Output files are saved in temporary storage.
Download URLs are issued with a timed token.
URLs with expired tokens are invalid.
File names are automatically generated and unique.
Report generation history is stored.
History includes generator ID, generation timestamp, and target period.
Concurrent mass generation is controlled by queue processing.
Queue processing is retried upon failure.
An error log is recorded after three failures.
Report generation processing is executed asynchronously.
The API response immediately returns a Job ID.
A Job status check API exists.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented.
Output data is protected against XSS.
Formula injection countermeasures are implemented for CSV output.
Output files are saved in encrypted storage.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Report generation success logs are stored.
Report generation failure logs are stored.
Audit logs include the operating user ID.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
A maximum output file size limit is set.
Processing fails if the size limit is exceeded.
Timeout limits are configured.
Long-duration processes are handled via split aggregation.
A caching mechanism reduces the load during regeneration.
The cache is invalidated when the period is changed.
Report templates are editable from the management screen.
Template change history is maintained.
A warning is output if data is missing.
Internal information is not returned during API errors.
Target response time is within 500ms (excluding generation processing).
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
